summary: This document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, summarizing interviews conducted by the OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with MCC employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details failures in protocol, including Epstein being left without a cellmate and non-functioning cameras, and notes that several officers refused to be interviewed without union representation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The document details the discovery of his body and the procedural failures surrounding his detention.

persons.name: Lt. Jean
persons.context: Arrived at MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019, responded to the medical call at the SHU, and performed CPR on Epstein. He questioned officers about the missing cellmate.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: A generic placeholder for multiple unnamed officers mentioned in the document. One officer discovered Epstein, another performed CPR, and others admitted to not conducting required counts.

connections.description: Lt. Jean was the operations lieutenant overseeing the prison shift when Epstein's body was discovered and administered CPR.
Multiple unnamed officers were responsible for Epstein's custody, including one who discovered his body and others who failed to assign him a cellmate or conduct proper counts.

events.title: Epstein left without cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was moved out, and he was not reassigned a new one, contrary to protocol. Several officers and supervisors were aware of this.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's body
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., a radio call for medical staff was made in the SHU. Epstein was found on the ground, having apparently hung himself. Officers performed CPR.

events.title: Voluntary interviews with MCC staff
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted voluntary interviews with several MCC employees regarding the events leading to Epstein's death.

keyFacts: At least 7 officers and 2 supervisors were aware Jeffrey Epstein did not have a cellmate on August 9, 2019, but did not reassign him one, violating protocol.
Epstein was found in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019; officers admitted to not conducting the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.
The camera system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held was not working at the time of his death.
Multiple correctional officers refused to be interviewed by the FBI and OIG without their union representatives present.
Epstein had been assisted in making an unrecorded legal phone call days before his death, where he claimed to be calling his mother.
